article:
'Route', 'Reuta', 'Rowte', or , was a medieval territory in County Antrim,
Northern Ireland consisting of the baronies of Dunluce Upper, Dunluce Lower,
Toome Lower, and the North East Liberties of Coleraine (in County Londonderry).
It also formed part of the more ancient kingdoms of DÃ¡l Riata and DÃ¡l nAraidi,
as well as the Earldom of Ulster. It was once ruled by the MacQuillans and later
the MacDonnells.
